intro: Anthospermum ternatum, commonly known as the three-lobed anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have three lobes, giving it its common name. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
